org.apache.juddi.v3.client.mapping

Class ServiceLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juddi.v3.client.mapping.ServiceLocator

  • public class ServiceLocator
extends Object
    The ServiceLocator contacts the UDDI registry to lookup an Endpoint given a UDDI ServiceKey.
    This class does NOT chase down WSDL, hosting redirectors or other binding references from access point useType values. See UDDIClerk.getEndpoints
    Author:
    Kurt T Stam
    See Also:
    SubscriptionCallbackListener

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServiceLocator

        public ServiceLocator(UDDIClerk clerk)
        Requirement in the config is a clerk with access credentials to the UDDI server you want the locator to do lookups to. When a live cache is used the clerk will register a callback into this UDDI server and the clerk will therefore need inquiry and publish access. The credentials can be set in the uddi-client.xml configuration file.
        Parameters:
        clerk - a UDDI Clerk with publish access to the UDDI Server.
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException

      • ServiceLocator

                      URLLocalizer urlLocalizer,
                      Properties properties)
               throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException

    • Method Detail

      • withCache

        public ServiceLocator withCache(URL baseCallbackURL)
                         throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Creates a new UDDIServiceCache, which brings up a new WebService Endpoint. This EndPoint will be called by the UDDI server if any service changes. A callback will result in cleaning the cache.
        Parameters:
        baseCallbackURL -
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException

      • withLiveCache

        public ServiceLocator withLiveCache(URL baseCallbackURL)
                             throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException,
                                    BindException
        A live cache will receive callbacks from the UDDI server in case there is an update to a service's bindings. All callbacks will clear the UDDIClientCache ensuring that subsequent lookups will contact the UDDI server for the latest binding information. The baseCallbackURL can be set to solve binding issue. If
        Parameters:
        baseCallbackURL -
        Returns:
        a service locator object
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        BindException

      • withSimpleCache

        public ServiceLocator withSimpleCache()

      • getUDDIServiceCache

        public UDDIServiceCache getUDDIServiceCache()

      • setPolicy

        public ServiceLocator setPolicy(String policy)
        The policy selection can be set as property "juddi.client.selection.policy" or it can be set programmatically using this method. A Policy is a class which implements the SelectionPolicy interface. Known implementations are org.apache.juddi.v3.client.mapping.PolicyLocalFirst and org.apache.juddi.v3.client.mapping.PolicyRoundRobin. If the policy is not set the default org.apache.juddi.v3.client.mapping.PolicyLocalFirst is used.
        Parameters:
        policy - - the desired policy.
        Returns:
        ServiceLocator
        See Also:
        PolicyLocalFirst, PolicyRoundRobin

      • getPolicy

        public SelectionPolicy getPolicy()
                          throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Returns the selection policy in use by this instance of the ServiceLocator.
        Returns:
        SelectionPolicy - the selection policy.

      • lookupEndpoint

        public String lookupEndpoint(String serviceKey)
                      throws RemoteException,
                             org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException,
                             TransportException
        Looks up the Endpoints for a Service. If the cache is in use it will try to obtain them from the cache. If no Endpoints are found, or if the cache is not in use, the clerk will do a lookup for this service. After Endpoints are found it will use a policy to pick one Endpoint to return. Returns null if no endpoints are found.
        Parameters:
        serviceKey -
        Returns:
        endpoint
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        TransportException

      • lookupEndpoint

        public String lookupEndpoint(QName serviceQName,
                             String portName)
                      throws RemoteException,
                             org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException,
                             TransportException
        Looks up the Endpoints for a Service. If the cache is in use it will try to obtain them from the cache. If no Endpoints are found, or if the cache is not in use, the clerk will do a lookup for this service. After Endpoints are found it will use a policy to pick one Endpoint to return. Returns null if no endpoints are found.
        Parameters:
        serviceQName -
        portName -
        Returns:
        Returns null if no endpoints are found.
        Throws:
        TransportException
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        RemoteException
